intro: Corydalis pauciflora var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant grows from a tuberous root system and produces a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually clustered in racemes and are adapted for pollination by insects. It is a relatively uncommon species, often found in rocky or woodland habitats at higher elevations.
